titleStmt.title: Grand plvtoes remonstrance, or, The devill horn-mad at Roundheads and Brownists wherein His hellish Maiestie, by advice of his great counsell, Eacus, Minos & Radamanthus, with his beloved brethren, agdistis, beliall, incubus & succubus : is pleased to declare 1. how far he differs from round-head, rattle-head or prickeare : 2. his copulation with a Holy Sister : 3. his decre affection to Romish Catholikes and hate to Protestants : 4. his oration to the rebells.

Grand plvtoes remonstrance, or, The devill horn-mad at Roundheads and Brownists wherein His hellish Maiestie, by advice of his great counsell, Eacus, Minos & Radamanthus, with his beloved brethren, agdistis, beliall, incubus & succubus : is pleased to declare 1. how far he differs from round-head, rattle-head or prickeare : 2. his copulation with a Holy Sister : 3. his decre affection to Romish Catholikes and hate to Protestants : 4. his oration to the rebells.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
Brathwaite, Richard, 1588?-1673.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: Don Antonio Demanibus, secretary to His Infernall Majesty.
Attributed to Richard Braithwaite in the Wrenn catalogue.
Attributed to John Taylor by Wing.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
